text: Moldova competed at the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano, Japan. ==Biathlon== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Event !Athlete !Misses 1 !Time !Rank |- |10 km Sprint |Ion Bucsa |align="center"|6 |align="center"|36:33.8 |align="center"|71 |} {|class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%" |- !Event !Athlete !Time !Misses !Adjusted time 2 !Rank |- |20 km |Ion Bucsa |align="center"|1'05:27.5 |align="center"|6 |align="center"|1'11:27.5 |align="center"|70 |} ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Event !Athlete !Misses 1 !Time !Rank |- |7.5 km Sprint |Elena Gorohova |align="center"|5 |align="center"|28:21.5 |align="center"|62 |} {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Event !Athlete !Time !Misses !Adjusted time 2 !Rank |- |15 km |Elena Gorohova |align="center"|1'00:18.1 |align="center"|9 |align="center"|1'09:18.1 |align="center"|62 |} : 1 A penalty loop of 150 metres had to be skied per missed target. : 2 One minute added per missed target. ==References== *Official Olympic Reports * Olympic Winter Games 1998, full results by sports- reference.com Category:Nations at the 1998 Winter Olympics 1998 Winter
